Comment:
Hi everyone!

Two games finished recently, one which involved me being on the receiving end of a successful mating attack and in the other game I was the one to dish it out.  Let's get the bad stuff out of the way first Ladies and Gentlemen.  This game is my 36th against Master Freddy and the outcome is becoming far too much of a ritual for my liking.  We pick up the action on move 5 where Freddy puts his king on e7.

21. f3? - I think this is where I went wrong, I now leave the g2 pawn weak and Freddy does make a target of it.
23. Qe2 - the usual dire role for Glenda, defending the g2 pawn.

24. ..... b5 - Freddy does not put his rook on g6 as I expected so I play h4 preparing h5 to stop this.  When Freddy misses a chance to win a pawn it does not mean an oversight - it may be a very bad sign - that he is after your king!
